meanings.definition: To distribute or disseminate information widely
meanings.sent1: The company decided to circularize the new product details to all customers.
meanings.sent2: They plan to circularize the event flyers to everyone in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The rumor mill started to circularize the gossip about the upcoming party.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter seemed to circularize throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh bread circularized through the bakery, enticing customers inside.

meanings.definition: To make something circular in shape or form
meanings.sent1: He used a compass to circularize the shape of the logo.
meanings.sent2: The artist wanted to circularize the design of the garden pathway.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to circularize the pancake but ended up with a square instead.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's movements seemed to circularize around the stage.
meanings.sent5: The potter carefully circularized the clay into a perfect bowl.
